comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: "Joe Edwards" was the alias for the welterweight German boxer Paul Maschke, who was a contender in the 'mixed rules' (boxing/wrestling) events that were taking place in parts of Europe. On February 1, 1907, Paul Maschke ('Joe Edwards') (Boxing) defeated the Frenchman, Edmond Vary (Jiu Jitsu) in Berlin. There was a rematch on August 11, 1907, between Maschke and Vary (Jiu Jitsu), also in Berlin. One source states that Vary lost again, another, a newspaper article from August 18, 1907, calls it a draw. [1] [2] [3] On May 17, 1908, in Copenhagen. Paul Maschke ('Joe Edwards') lost in a match with welterweight Johannes Jørgensen, (1867-1913), who used the alias "Jim Smith", [4] Joe's wife, Rose "Edwards" was also a boxer. Two photographs of her are featured on Flickr. "Jim Smith's" (LOC) photograph can be seen here:   There are two other (LOC) photographs of "Joe Edwards" on Flickr here:             "Joe Edwards"          by LOC      "Boxing class in Joe Edward's School, Berlin" by LOC
